snippet: The ever-thinning ranks of triple-A-rated states may soon lose another if the Standard & Poor's Corporation lowers the rating of California's general obligation debt.    Standard & Poor's announced yesterday that it had placed under review for pos...
lead_paragraph: The ever-thinning ranks of triple-A-rated states may soon lose another if the Standard & Poor's Corporation lowers the rating of California's general obligation debt. Standard & Poor's announced yesterday that it had placed under review for possible downgrading some $11.6 billion in California general obligation bonds as a result of a rapidly developing deficit that is projected for the fiscal years 1991 and 1992.

headline.main: Review of California's Debt May Result in Downgrading
